title: In Praise of the Ironsmith - identify concepts

content.description:
In Praise of the Ironsmith
Today this place is full of noise and jollitycelebration.
The guiding spirit that enables my husband to forgeto shape metal by heating makes him do wonders.
All those who lack hoes for weeding, come and buy!
Hoes and choppers are here in plenty.
My husband is a craftsman in iron,
Truly a wizard at forging hoes.
Ah, here they are! They have come eager to find hoes.
Ah, the iron itself is aglow, it is molten red with heat,
And the ore is ruddy and incandescent.
My husband is an expert in working iron,
A craftsman who sticks like wax to his trade.
On the day when the urge to forge comes upon him,
The bellowsa fan used to increase the heat of a fire do everything but speak.
The pile of slagwaste created when working with iron rises higher and higher.
Just look at what has been forged,
At the choppers, at the hoes, at the battle axes,
And here at the pile of hatchets, large and small.
Then look at the double-bladed knives and the adzes.
Merely to list them all seems like boasting.
As for fowlsbirds raised for meat or eggs and goats, they cover my yard.
They all come from the sale of tools and weapons.
Here is where you see me eating at ease with a spoon.
Source: Unknown author, Shona Praise Poetry
content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the Bantu expansion?

choices.label: Migration contributed to the spread of a language family throughout West, Central, and Southern Africa.
Abundant gold contributed to the growth of the trans-Saharan trade routes in West and North Africa.
Economic conflict contributed to Nubia’s conquest of Egypt in Northeast Africa.
Agricultural innovations contributed to population growth in North Africa.

content.answer: Migration contributed to the spread of a language family throughout West, Central, and Southern Africa.
